name: Greek Mythology, Part 1 Trivia Game | Greek Myth | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the author of the Theogony?
questions.explanation:
Hesiod.

	Hesiod was from Ascra in Boeotia.  He wrote the Theogony, a retelling of the geneology of the Greek gods, from which the information here in this quiz originated.

questions.text: What was the name of the vast darkness created by chaos during the foundation of existence?
questions.explanation:
Erebus.

	The Greek Hades arose within the realm of Erebus.

questions.text: Which reality was the first to come into existence in this theology?
questions.explanation:
Earth.

	Chaos preceded the Earth, known as Gaea.

questions.text: After creating the sky, what was the next creation of Gaea (mother earth)?
Who was the eldest of the Titans?
Which Titaness was associated with justice?
Which Titaness represented, in a spiritual sense, the concept of time?
questions.explanation:
Mnemosyne.

	She was the goddess of remembrance or memory.

questions.text: The term for Earth's primordial sea was the namesake of which Titan or Titaness?
What did the 3,000 children of Tethys and Oceanus become?
questions.explanation:
waves.

	It makes sense when you consider that Oceanus and Tethys were both associated with the sea. Their children were called the Oceanids.
